text: The National Space Science Data Center (NSSDC) is an archive that stores NASA space science mission data. "Space science" means astronomy and astrophysics, solar and space plasma physics, and planetary and lunar science. It also stores space physics mission data. The NSSDC was first established at the Goddard Space Flight Center in 1966. ==References== Category:Space research organizations Category:NASA Category:Spaceflight Category:1966 establishments in the United States
title: National Space Science Data Center
